author: Russ Alan Prince
title: Creating A Charitable Legacy Using Life Insurance
text: There are various products and strategies, which can be used to facilitate meaningful gifts to non-profits. Often they fall under the category of planned gifts and result in creating a significant family legacy. Life insurance can be an exceedingly powerful planned gift. The idea of creating a charitable legacy is appealing to a substantial number of successful and wealthy families. A well designed and implemented charitable plan can have enormous benefits to both the wealthy family and the charitable organization. For the donors, there are a number of tax benefits depending on the assets being used to make the gift and the type of charity – public or private.From the perspective of the wealthy family, charitable planning generally falls under income and estate tax planning and is regularly part of a broader wealth management agenda. As such, there are different ways donors can benefit. Some examples include: Creating a lifetime income stream for individuals t Diversifying highly concentrated stock positions without the need to pay taxes on the sale t Transferring substantial assets to heirs without paying estate taxes Life insurance can often be a very important component of a high-caliber charitable plan. According to Frank Seneco, President of Seneco & Associates , an advanced planning boutique and author of Maximizing Personal Wealth: An Advanced Planning Primer for Successful Business Owners , “Life insurance – when properly structured and in accordance with the wishes of the family – can be a very powerful way to benefit worthy causes. At the same time, it can provide some beneficial tax benefits to the donors. Some of the benefits of using life insurance include leverage by using discounted dollars and certitude that the gift will be made.”“For the very wealthy, entertainers, and athletes , we have found that life insurance can be a very effective and inexpensive way for them to make seriously substantive charitable gifts to causes important to them,” explains Evan Jehle, partner FFO Business Management & Family Office . “It is a way for them to help create a long term legacy and assure its continuation. Although making a charitable gift using life insurance might sound simple, there are more and less effective ways to do so often requiring the process to be expertly managed to get optimal results.”There are a variety of charitable planning strategies donors can use to benefit others and create a legacy. Life insurance can be used to help them achieve this goal.
